com.mappedin.sdk.interfaces

Class SimplePanelSlideListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mappedin.sdk.interfaces.SimplePanelSlideListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PanelSlideListener

    public class SimplePanelSlideListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements PanelSlideListener
    No-op stubs for PanelSlideListener. If you only want to implement a subset of the listener methods you can extend this instead of implement the full interface.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimplePanelSlideListener() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onPanelAnchored(android.view.View panel)
      Called when a sliding pane is anchored mid-way between the screen
      void onPanelCollapsed(android.view.View panel)
      Called when a sliding pane becomes slid completely collapsed.
      void onPanelExpanded(android.view.View panel)
      Called when a sliding pane becomes slid completely expanded.
      void onPanelHidden(android.view.View panel)
      Called when a sliding pane hidden from the user and is not visible in the UI anymore

      You can use this callback to listen to the user has exited or stopped looking at directions or locations details
      void onPanelShown(android.view.View panel)
      Called when a sliding pane is made visible to the user.
      void onPanelSlide(android.view.View panel, float slideOffset)
      Called when a sliding pane's position changes.

    • Method Detail

      • onPanelSlide

        public void onPanelSlide(android.view.View panel,
                float slideOffset)
        Description copied from interface: PanelSlideListener
        Called when a sliding pane's position changes.
        Specified by:
        onPanelSlide in interface PanelSlideListener
        Parameters:
        panel - The child view that was moved
        slideOffset - The new offset of this sliding pane within its range, from 0-1

      • onPanelCollapsed

        public void onPanelCollapsed(android.view.View panel)
        Description copied from interface: PanelSlideListener
        Called when a sliding pane becomes slid completely collapsed. The pane may or may not be interactive at this point depending on if it's shown or hidden
        Specified by:
        onPanelCollapsed in interface PanelSlideListener
        Parameters:
        panel - The child view that was slid to an collapsed position, revealing other panes

      • onPanelExpanded

        public void onPanelExpanded(android.view.View panel)
        Description copied from interface: PanelSlideListener
        Called when a sliding pane becomes slid completely expanded. The pane is now guaranteed to be interactive. It may now obscure other views in the layout.
        Specified by:
        onPanelExpanded in interface PanelSlideListener
        Parameters:
        panel - The child view that was slid to a expanded position

      • onPanelAnchored

        public void onPanelAnchored(android.view.View panel)
        Description copied from interface: PanelSlideListener
        Called when a sliding pane is anchored mid-way between the screen
        Specified by:
        onPanelAnchored in interface PanelSlideListener
        Parameters:
        panel - The child view that was slid to an anchored position

      • onPanelShown

        public void onPanelShown(android.view.View panel)
        Description copied from interface: PanelSlideListener
        Called when a sliding pane is made visible to the user. The sliding pane is guaranteed to be visible within the UI at this point.
        Specified by:
        onPanelShown in interface PanelSlideListener
        Parameters:
        panel - The child view that was slid to an anchored position

      • onPanelHidden

        public void onPanelHidden(android.view.View panel)
        Description copied from interface: PanelSlideListener
        Called when a sliding pane hidden from the user and is not visible in the UI anymore

        You can use this callback to listen to the user has exited or stopped looking at directions or locations details
        Specified by:
        onPanelHidden in interface PanelSlideListener
        Parameters:
        panel - The child view that was slid to an anchored position
